settings.autoConfigWarning1: If this option is not selected you will have to manually setup the Button+ using it's web interface.
settings.autoConfigWarning2: Warning: With this option on, the app will overwrite the existing button+ configuration so that it can operate with this app.
settings.buttonExplanation:
Button Configrations can be applied to one or more Button+ button bars to determine what is displayed.
The button bar is a panel, with 2 mini displays and 2 buttons, that can be used to control On/Off and Dim type devices or run flows.
The Configurations can be applied to physical button bars either in the Homey app's Panel device or by using Flows
settings.displayExplanation:
Display Configrations can be applied to one or more large Button+ displays to determine what is displayed.
You define the X and Y position of the top left corner of the item and it's width all as a percentage of the display width.
You can define multiple items to display but make sure they all fit.
settings.brokerExplanation:
You can define multiple brokers to connect to. Each broker can have multiple devices and each device can have multiple capabilities.
Each broker can be enabled or disabled. If disabled, no features will be published to it.
settings.topLabelExplanation: The Top Label is shown along the top of the mini display. It can be used to show the name of the device or flow that is controlled by the button.
settings.label: Label
settings.labelOnExplantion: The labels to show when the button is in the On state.
settings.labelOffExplantion: The labels to show when the button is in the Off state.
settings.deviceExplanation:
Select the device to control when you press the Button+ button.
Only devices with On/Off or Dim capabilities will be shown.
If you select none, then nothing is directly controlled but you will still get the button pressed Flow trigger
settings.dimError: Dim __leftRight__ Change must be between ±1 and ±100. Please correct and try again.
settings.brokerIdExplanation: Select the Broker ID that you wan to send and receive messages from.
settings.address: Address (IP or URL) of the broker
settings.id: Broker ID (to identify the broker and must be unique)
settings.brokerHomey: This is the app's own broker. It can not be deleted but can be disabled if you don't want to use it.
settings.brokerUser: This is a user defined broker. It can be deleted or disabled.
settings.duplicateBrokerIdError: Broker ID '__brokerId__' already exists. Please correct and try again.
settings.MQTTTopicExplanation: This is an optional custom MQTT topic that will be published when the button is pressed. Leave blank to toggle the Homey device button and trigger a Homey Flow.
settings.dimChangeExplanation:
The amount to change the dim level when the button is pressed.
This can be a positive or negative number to either brighten or darken the device.
Example +10 to increase the dim level bu 10% each time the button is pressed, or -10 to decrease the dim level.
If you omit the + or - then the dim value will be set to the specified level.
settings.topicExplanation: The MQTT topic to subscribe to.
settings.payloadExplanation: The MQTT payload to match against or send.
settings.MQTTIdExplanation: This is optional for your information only
settings.frontLEDColorExplanation: The color of the front LED when the button is in the On state.
settings.wallLEDColorExplanation: The color of the wall LED when the button is in the On state.
settings.email: Email Address or Forum id (Required if you want me to respond)
settings.sendLogConfirm: Send the log contents to the developer?

hello2: Open the Button+ Homey app settings to setup configurations
hello3: Then use the Button+ Homey device to assign configurations
